Member Function Documentation

bool org.pdfclown.documents.contents.tokens.Parser.MoveNext (  ) 

Parse the next token [PDF:1.6:3.1].

Contract:

Preconditions:

  1. To properly parse the current token, the pointer MUST be just before its starting (leading whitespaces are ignored).

Postconditions:

  1. When this method terminates, the pointer IS at the last byte of the current token.

Invariants:

  1. The byte-level position of the pointer IS anytime (during token parsing) at the end of the current token (whereas the 'current token' represents the token-level position of the pointer).

Side-effects:

  1. See Postconditions.
Returns:
Whether a new token was found.
bool org.pdfclown.documents.contents.tokens.Parser.MoveNext ( int  offset  ) 
Parameters:
offset Number of tokens to be skipped before reaching the intended one.
ContentObject org.pdfclown.documents.contents.tokens.Parser.ParseContentObject (  ) 

Parses the next content object [PDF:1.6:4.1], may it be a single operation or a graphics object.

List<ContentObject> org.pdfclown.documents.contents.tokens.Parser.ParseContentObjects (  ) 
Operation org.pdfclown.documents.contents.tokens.Parser.ParseOperation (  ) 
PdfDirectObject org.pdfclown.documents.contents.tokens.Parser.ParsePdfObject (  ) 

Require[0]: when this method is invoked, the pointer MUST be at (the end of) the first token of the object.

Ensure[0]: when this method terminates, the pointer IS at (the end of) the last token of the object.

Invariant[0]: stream data IS kept untouched.

Side effect[0]: see Ensure[0].

References org.pdfclown.objects.PdfArray.Add().

PdfDataObject org.pdfclown.documents.contents.tokens.Parser.ContentStream [get]

Gets the content stream on which parsing is done.

A content stream may be made up of either a single stream or an array of streams.
